intro: Talinum rugospermum, commonly known as rough-seeded spinach, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that develop into spiny, triangular capsules. It is often cultivated for its edible leaves, which have a mild, spinach-like flavor. Talinum rugospermum thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is adapted to warm, humid climates.
